etymology.description: Phonetic: 來 (come) + Semantic: 夊 (slow footprint) = growth & origin -> wheat
etymology.interpretation: The character 麥 emphasizes growth and origin, with 來 providing the phonetic cue and 夊 suggesting movement or growth. This combination cleverly reflects wheat as both a growing plant and a staple arriving from ancient trade or cultivation.
etymology.simplification: The 八 component in traditional 麥 was altered into a single horizontal line in simplified 麦, simplifying the character form.

parts.english: footprint pointing down; to walk slowly

examples.chinese: 这片田里种了很多麦(這片田裡種了很多麥)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè piàn tián lǐ zhòng le hěn duō mài.
examples.english: Many wheat crops are planted in this field.

examples.chinese: 他喜欢吃麦片(他喜歡吃麥片)。
